title: [BUG] Crash bug in SKTouchHandler.OnTouch
body:
**Description**

https://github.com/mscherotter/SkiaSharp/blob/master/source/SkiaSharp.Views.Forms/SkiaSharp.Views.Forms.Android/SKTouchHandler.cs

    var toolType = evt.GetToolType(id); 

in line 50 incorrectly passes the pointerID, not the pointer index and causes an exception: pointerIndex out of range

**Code**
The line should be 

    var toolType = evt.GetToolType(pointer);

**Expected Behavior**

No exception

**Actual Behavior**

An exception when touching the canvas
**Basic Information**

- Version with issue:  1.68.2-preview.50
- Last known good version:  1.68.2-preview.45
- IDE:   Visual Studio 
- Platform Target Frameworks: Android
  - Android: 9.0 
- Target Devices:   <!-- the devices that you noticed this on, e.g. iPhone X -->
  - <!-- Google Pixel 4 XL -->
  - <!-- iPhone 11 -->

**Screenshots**

<!-- if the issue is a visual issue, please include screenshots showing the problem if possible -->

**Reproduction Link**

<!-- please upload or provide a link to a reproduction case -->
